sorcer.core.monitor

Interface MonitorSessionManagement

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Monitorable, MonitorManagement
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    MonitoringManagement
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    ExertMonitor

    public interface MonitorSessionManagement
extends MonitorManagement
    A server side session manager. Clients call on session manager to manage individual sessions data. The session is activated by the manager when init(monitorable, duration, timeout) is called by broker. From this moment, the Manager will require that the monitorable renew the leases for the specified duration. If the task is not complete for the specified duration, the monitor will send stop signal to the monitorable and notify the Broker via RemoteEventListener.notify(). For Space based programming, since we don't know who will execute the job, broker calls init(space, timeout, duration). This means that the monitor is going to mark the timeout and duration of this session. Note that from this moment, the session is not activated. It waits till the timeout period for some monitorable provider to pick up and call init(monitorable). From this moment on, the session is activated and leases have to be renewed. Once providers revieves the session (which is normally sent inside the exertion) They may call update() stop() getLease() or getState(). The getState is actually delegated to the SessionManager remotely.

    • Method Detail

      • init

        Lease init(Uuid cookie,
           Monitorable mntrbl,
           long duration,
           long timeout)
    throws RemoteException,
           MonitorException
        Makes this an active session. The rendezvous decides the lease duration and the timeout after which the monitor will call on monitorables that the job is failed and report back to the Listener that the exertion of this session has failed.
        Parameters:
        mntrbl - The monitorable to which this task is dispatched.
        duration - Requested lease duration for the session.
        timeout - Timeout for execution of this task.
        Throws:
        MonitorException - 1) If this session is already active 2) If there is no such session
        RemoteException - if there is a communication error
        See Also:
        TransactionConstants

      • init

        void init(Uuid cookie,
          long duration,
          long timeout)
   throws RemoteException,
          MonitorException
        If the Broker wants to drop the exertion to space, then the Broker has no idea who will pick up this exertion. In that case, it doesn't make sense for the broker to force leasing. However, it may activate the the session with the timeout marked and the lease duration specified so that if no provider picks out and the task gets timed out, then we can clean up the entry from space and notify the broker. If the provider picks up before it timesout, then the provider must initialize this session by calling init(Monitorable) so that the monitor will now make sure that the leases are renewed properly for this session.
        Parameters:
        duration - Requested lease duration for the session.
        timeout - Timeout for execution of this task wich includes idle time in space.
        Throws:
        MonitorException - 1) If this session is already active 2) If there is no such session
        RemoteException - if there is a communication error

      • init

        Lease init(Uuid cookie,
           Monitorable mntrbl)
    throws RemoteException,
           MonitorException
        If the Broker wants to drop the exertion to space, then the Broker has no idea who will pick up this exertion. In that case, the broker would have already set the lease duration and timeout. The provider who picks up the entry must initialize this session by calling init(Monitorable) so that the we will now know that the task with the monitorable and also will make sure that the leases are renewed properly for this session.
        Parameters:
        mntrbl - The monitorable who picked this up.
        Throws:
        MonitorException - 1) If there is no such session 2) The execution has been inited by some one else.
        RemoteException - if there is a communication error

      • update

        void update(Uuid cookie,
            Context ctx,
            IControlContext controlContext,
            int aspect)
     throws RemoteException,
            MonitorException
        Providers use this method to update the state of monitorable exertion.
        Parameters:
        ctx - The service dataContext of monitorable exertion.
        aspect - The aspect of dataContext change.
        Throws:
        MonitorException - 1) If there is no such session 2) The dataContext does not belong to this session
        RemoteException - if there is a communication error
